alert.note: Alert for Arthur; Garden; Grant; Sheridan; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 1:30AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Arthur, southwestern Cherry, western Grant, northern Garden and southern Sheridan Counties through 130 AM MDT... At 1230 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 16 miles south of Rushville to 9 miles east of Wild Horse Butte to near Alliance. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ellsworth, Hyannis, Ashby, Antioch, Crescent Lake National Wildlife Refuge, Big Hill, Dogtown Flats, Dipping Vat Meadow, Billys Lake, Swede Lake, Deer Lake, Britton Lake, Intersection of Highway 61 and Survey Valley Road, Miles Lake, Mumper, Wickson Lake, Diamond Lake, Herman Lake, Whitman Road crossing the North Branch of the Middle Loup River and Adams Flats. This includes the following highways... Highway 250 between mile markers 1 and 41. Highway 2 between mile markers 96 and 151. Highway 61 between mile markers 154 and 186. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM MDT for the Panhandle of, north central and west central Nebraska.

area.areaDesc: Arthur; Garden; Grant; Sheridan; Western Cherry
